website_summaries.verdict: An extra-comfortable boot for all seasons.
pros: A soft footbed, good arch support, and a padded five-inch collar make this boot a comfortable pick
These boots shouldn't need to be broken in, and the Vibram sole provides great traction on tough surfaces
cons: These aren't the most durable boots, as some customers report that the soles wear down after some time

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable but the sole wears faster than other boots
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable boot. I don't think it really has enough support for real backpacking trips but for day hikes over rougher terrain or overnight treks would certainly do the job. They break in very quickly and are as comfortable as running shoes. The glove leather interior is a nice plus. I took a star off because of its durability. The soles are softer and wear kind of quickly, much faster than I feel a boot at this price range should. However, I know most people don't do the kind of hiking I do so this probably wouldn't be a concern.
customer_reviews.author: theFarmingDude

customer_reviews.title: These Lowas fit horribly bad on my feet.
customer_reviews.text: These Lowas fit horribly bad on my feet. Not sure whats up with LOWA but these boots are not even close. I wanted to keep them because of the cool leather lining, but really the fit was just horrible on my feet, so i returned them right away. I think the Lowa footbed may be very narrow, and its hard to get the right fit without trying out a few. Fortunately Amazon lets you return what doesn't fit right, so that was awesome. no loss, no harm in trying these, and i learned a bit in the process. The LOWA Tibets are a real nice boot and thats what is ended up getting to replace these :-)
customer_reviews.author: RhythmRancher

customer_reviews.title: They run a little small
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty nice boots for the money, and are the only reasonably priced boots I can get on my feet. My true size is 14 EEE, and I have had size 14 EE in the renegade, and it was painfully tight. I ordered 2 pair of 15's, one D and one EE, and I kept the EE. They are still a little tight, especially in the toe box. They are sturdy, lightweight hikers worthy of the steepest, rockiest terrain you will encounter. I just wish for a better fit.
customer_reviews.author: Richard F. Arthur III

customer_reviews.title: best hiking boots ever
customer_reviews.text: We are a family who field tests boots whenever the weather will let us. We cover miles and we each have a pair of the Renegades. These are the best boots we have ever had. They are comfortable out of the box, never any blisters, and they last. The leather lining is luxurious and very cushy. We highly recommend these boots.
customer_reviews.author: KariKari

customer_reviews.title: Great fitting boot
customer_reviews.text: Boots have been comfortable from the first time I put them on. I have backpacked and hiked quite a few miles in them now and after snow sealing them a couple times they are quite waterproof. I even walked through a stream in a cave in them without getting wet feet. The leather did absorb some water though. they fit true to their size and are wearing in nicely, I expect them to last for quite a while so long as I do my part to maintain the leather. The leather inner feels great against your leg/ ankle. I have and would recommend this boot to anyone who loves to camp, hike, fish, hunt, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B.

customer_reviews.title: Best Boot for the Money!
customer_reviews.text: I had Baffins before, and wanted something lighter for day hikes. This is the boot! I love the smooth glove leather interior. Right from the start no blisters or anything. Very comfortable, even after five hours of hard hiking. The only thing: My Baffins were 11.5 in size, and I had to go to 13 with the Renegade to achieve the same comfort. They may be a bit more roomy at 13 than the 11.5 Baffin, i.e. going one size larger for the same comfort may be a good rule of thumb. Definitely, order a couple different sizes and try for best fit. Keep hiking!
customer_reviews.author: Cleaver Greene

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots as they should be for the price. They are worth it though. The arch support rating is difficult, I have flat feet so for me they don't give enough support and I add my own orthotics, but for others they may be fine. They are very well made and comfortable. I put a good coat of water proofer on mine before I used them which darkens up the leather a little bit. They are advertised as waterproof but I figure it can't hurt.
customer_reviews.author: JTB

customer_reviews.title: My favorite boots.
customer_reviews.text: These fit as well as a pair of custom-made boots I have, and they weigh less than half as much! However, after one year of hard use on trails the toe-caps are coming unstitched and will have to be resewn. Each boot is made from twelve pieces of leather stitched together (fourrteen, counting the leather liner and tongue), and the back edges of the toe-caps fall right where the boots crease. Also, mine are the leather-lined model, and they squeak when I walk. I've gotten used to it, but some of my bird watcher friends are thrown by the squeaks.
customer_reviews.author: F J F Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Boots made for walking
customer_reviews.text: Bought these boots about 6 months ago. I have somewhat "difficult feet" and needed something supportive for my ankles and cushioning for my soles. I got the leather lined ones as I thought that would provide more cushioning. It's taken a while to break them in, about 2 months of frequent wear. At first there was uneven fit with areas of my foot rubbing raw but all this resolved with inserting new insoles I bought at CVS. Since then, the quality of the fit has increased dramatically! Now these are my every day wear. These boots are a great value except the insoles.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar G Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: They are super comfortable, and felt broken in almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: These boots kick ass. They are super comfortable, and felt broken in almost immediately. They look really nice. The soles are bulletproof (not literally) and haven't worn much at all. The glove leather upper insole is nice and soft. I haven't done a darn thing to care for them and they still look great after a year of frequent wear. I've had Lowa's before, done some serious hiking in them, and there's no destroying them - they are sturdy, strong, supportive, comfortable boots that last and last. Lowa boots are worth every darn penny.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Ajo

customer_reviews.title: At least the thief knew a great boot when they saw one
customer_reviews.text: I worn these while hiking the Camino de Santiago, only to have them stolen as I slept one night. At least the thief knew a great boot when they saw one! Luckily, I always pack a pair of Teva's for down time and I ended up completing the hike in them.
customer_reviews.author: Ramblin RobTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: No Durability!!
customer_reviews.text: Got them in March 2017 and by August 2017 they are separated at the seams near the toes and the soles have begun to come away where the arch of my foot it. Love Lowa, just not the renegades.
customer_reviews.author: JWK

customer_reviews.title: Not as large as some other brands size 8.5, which is good for me.
customer_reviews.text: These Lowa Renegade LL boots fit exactly the same as my Renegade GTX size 8.5 boots. Just a little loose, so then perfect with thick socks. Really light weight too, but still very sturdy at the same time. Also, the most comfortable boots I own, glad I bought them. My feet are a little wide, with some brands (Rockport) I need a wide size, not with Lowa. And with Asics and Hi-tec, for example, I need size 8.5 even with thin socks, and they wouldn't be comfortable for extended hours of wear, like the Lowa's are.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Boots
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boot. I have the leather-lined high-top version (no Gore-Tex) and the synthetic-lined low-top version. I really like the leather lining in the high-top, which is much more durable (I always wear out the heel of the synthetic linings of boots before the rest of the boot), but I miss the Gore-Tex waterproofing. Nevertheless, with an occasional NikWax treatment, these are almost as waterproof as Gore-Tex and are among the most comfortable lightweight (light duty) hiking boots I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: CML

customer_reviews.title: Super narrow.
customer_reviews.text: They look like nice boots, although they seem pretty light and feel cheap. The main problem is the narrowness of them. I ordered the extra wide and they were more like a narrow width than even a normal boot does. I really wanted the leather lined feature too, very disappointed. Had to return. Oh yeah, I even got a half a size larger and they were still too narrow
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: The Very Best Hiking Boots I've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of hiking in the 70's and my boots were always heavy, clunky, stiff, and required lots of break-in before you dared head out on an extended hike. These boots are sneaker comfortable right out of the box and they exude quality. I wear an 11 in Skechers so I ordered my boots in 11.5 to allow for room in the toes when walking downhill. The fit is absolutely perfect.
customer_reviews.author: R. O'D

customer_reviews.title: Size 15D Lowa Trekkers may be a Better Fit
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars for the product's superior quality and Amazon's return policy. Unfortunately, these size 15D Renegades were too tight and short for my feet. (For illustration, size 15D New Balance products fit perfectly.) Incredibly, though, the size 15D Lowa Trekkers feel one size bigger and wider, even though they're from the same maker! Ended up keeping the Trekkers for a perfect and ample fit.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: ... of boots by Lowa the first was all Gortex super comfortable but didn't hold up to the rocks of ...
customer_reviews.text: These are my second set of boots by Lowa the first was all Gortex super comfortable but didn't hold up to the rocks of NH. These being leather took some breaking in which is fine. But the seams on the top of the boot up by the toes rub the tops of your toes for no reason and the part of the sole that rises up on the sides separated the first good hike. Traction is better than my first set but for the money a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: these are the best damm boots on the planet
customer_reviews.text: these are the best damm boots on the planet. I use them for work and they take everything. the leather inside is soft and I often wear with low cut socks. I like these better than the Solomon's. don't get the Gore-Tex lined ones unless you really need them.
customer_reviews.author: WE_BE_KILLING_UM

customer_reviews.title: Super!
customer_reviews.text: The most comfortable pair of boots I have ever owned, bar none! My feet are impressed. These boots have been in daily use for 10 weeks now and I haven't changed my mind. They are the best I've owned and I feel they are a value.
customer_reviews.author: food for thought

customer_reviews.title: The renegade pro and ice gtx are the best boots I have ever worn and I am a ...
customer_reviews.text: The renegade pro and ice gtx are the best boots I have ever worn and I am a boot fanatic. But these renegade II boots really hurt my arch. Seemed like a design flaw. Which is odd as they are all basically the same boot. Do yourself a favor and don't let this review ruin Lowa for you. Use it for what it's worth and go buy the renegade pro and then the renegade ice gtx if you live in cold and ice winters. Those boots are the benchmark of all else.
customer_reviews.author: SunWorshiper

customer_reviews.title: light comfortable, leather will conform to your foot
customer_reviews.text: I am 6 feet 250 lbs with wide problem feet. I bought the 14/48.5 mid-wide size. At first I wondered if I had made a mistake but after wearing them several times for several miles on my hikes with my dogs the leather began to conform to my feet and now I love them. Each boot weighs 1 lb. 11 oz. but they feel like featherweight bedroom slippers to me
customer_reviews.author: Barefoot old guy

customer_reviews.title: LOWA Renegade Hiking Boots
customer_reviews.text: The LOWA Renegades fit perfectly. I really like the cushioned inner padding around the ankles. The quick lace up is a definite plus and provides the ability to firmly secure the boot around the upper ankle area.
customer_reviews.author: James Pelican

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfy. Next time I would get the GTX.
customer_reviews.text: Solid, comfortable boots for rugged, dry conditions. The tread is soft and grips well when crossing slick creek rocks, but is also durable on sharp, rocky terrain. The small decorative splits in the rubber by the toe box came loose with time and rugged, wet travel. These leather lined boots breathe really well, but I would have to try the GTX version next time for improved water resistance.
customer_reviews.author: N. Golden

customer_reviews.title: Good, but fit small.
customer_reviews.text: Good boots, but they fit at least 1/2 to 1 size too small. I wear size 11 in every single shoe & boot I own, and these were way too small. I bought these to compare to the Lowa Camino and Catalan. Although I haven't received the Catalan yet, the Camino has the Renegade beat in all aspects.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Boots!
customer_reviews.text: I now know why these boots have such great reviews. Super, super comfortable. The leather lining conforms to your ankle making these fit just right. Great traction so far on various terrains including rain slick concrete. Haven't had them long enough to judge durability but the quality of the leather, materials and stitching make me think these will be around for a long time. I think Lowa just gained a life long customer.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Graham

customer_reviews.title: I have always had good luck buying Lowa boots
customer_reviews.text: I have always had good luck buying Lowa boots. I get a great fit that doesn't require any breaking in period. Light weight and comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Alan C Truman

customer_reviews.title: i didn't feel the arch support and it looked like my feet were sliding towards the front of shoes
customer_reviews.text: I wear true size 13 and these shoes are to small, toes touching front of the shoe... i didn't feel the arch support and it looked like my feet were sliding towards the front of shoes, every time i walked. They look great and seems like quality item, but do to smaller size I had to return them....
customer_reviews.author: Nerijus Bandzevicius

customer_reviews.title: Ultra comfort!
customer_reviews.text: Like walking on a cloud. I bought these after buying a pair of Lowa low renegades that were super comfortable, these may be even more comfortable due to the boot being a little higher. They actually improve with time but were a great fit right out of the box. Love the leather lineing, no hot spots even after a several mile hike. Great quality, highly recommended. Mark in Idaho
customer_reviews.author: Mark K.

customer_reviews.title: Love that leather liner
customer_reviews.text: The leather liner is just as I expected. It holds my foot snugly, but causes no blisters or hot spots. I did replace the felt insole, as I live in Florida and they made the boots too warm. Put the Gel insoles in and my feet are very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Jack McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: these boots are amazing!
customer_reviews.text: at first I thought I don't need the leather lining. however after owning these boots. I have found they keep the smell down a lot. they fit amazing. I wore these straight out of the box without worries of a break in period.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My first Leather-lined boots ... comfortable right away, good lacing system, quiet, lightweight. Great for a light hiking/hunting boot.
customer_reviews.author: jgh

customer_reviews.title: Good Boots!
customer_reviews.text: So I went and figured out what size that would fit and went on amazon and found a cheaper price for the same boot. I sealed these up and hiked up Mt. Rainer a few times in the rain and snow. Choice product for any hiker.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Like this boot. Great construction. Light weight and comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Giem

customer_reviews.title: It's a great boot and I have hiked in the regular Renegades
customer_reviews.text: It's a great boot and I have hiked in the regular Renegades, size 8D, for years. This leather lined II Pro pair is either mismarked or they have a different last and narrowed the toe box just enough to be uncomfortable. The regular Renegades are still fine.
customer_reviews.author: ConsumerRascal

customer_reviews.title: Good boot
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good boot, went on a three day hike through mud and water and rain and never had wet feet. They do extremely well in the snow without having cold feet. Very light and comfortable I have two pair.
customer_reviews.author: mBm

customer_reviews.title: great boot
customer_reviews.text: Great boot, picked it up after seeing a review for it on ITStactical's website. Its a great fit, light weight and seems durable enough. I haven't had a chance to do more than break them in yet, but I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mosby

customer_reviews.title: Narrow Low Volume Boot
customer_reviews.text: The wide version still runs narrow and the boot is low volume overall. The leather lining only covers the heel/ankle area and stops mid foot. I returned the boots right away but the construction seemed okay for the price point (though lots of seams) and they would require very little break-in. The return process to Amazon was great. I switched to the Vasque Summit GTX which is both a wider and higher volume boot.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: boots for life
customer_reviews.text: i thnk this are the best boots ever... i have 14 size and fits great in my feet. For the winter and for Hiking are the best, boots for life A+++
customer_reviews.author: Juan Segui

customer_reviews.title: I ordered my size and they fit perfect. They didn't run small as I have read
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about the sizing. I ordered my size and they fit perfect. They didn't run small as I have read. My foot is a little wide and in some boots I have to buy a W size. Not these, the M fits great. These are quality boots! You'll see what I'm talking about when you take them out of the box and put them on your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Melton

customer_reviews.title: Amazing boot
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband and he says they are the most comfortable hiking boots around. Zero blisters from the first day. He loves the boots.
customer_reviews.author: Trudi Dibb

customer_reviews.title: best boots & wide size.
customer_reviews.text: great company, great products, wonderful to find wide fit selection. The quality is some of best in the world love these boots Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: My first Lowa boots...
customer_reviews.text: These boots replaced my 12 year old Vasque hikers. I am pleased with the comfort and ankle support of these boots.
customer_reviews.author: DEMETER

customer_reviews.title: Always Lowa for me
customer_reviews.text: Another great Lowa boot. The total black looks cool. I can comfortably hike for hours and the soles really grip whatever surface you're on.
customer_reviews.author: R Hart

customer_reviews.title: These boots are amazing. These are my second pair of Lowa's
customer_reviews.text: These boots are amazing. These are my second pair of Lowa's. My previous pair lasted just of 10 years of near continuous wear and abuse, expecting the same from these ones. Amazing boot.
customer_reviews.author: DGGrover

customer_reviews.title: Love them fuccck yeah!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th pair since 2008. Absolutely love these boots!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best boots that I have ever owned. My feet love these.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy S.

customer_reviews.title: The boots were good but fit way smaller than i expected
customer_reviews.text: The boots were good but fit way smaller than i expected. It took about 2 weeks of wearing them and dealing with the discomfort till they stretched out enough and from then on they have been great. Have had them for about a year and a half.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: I originally wanted Haix hiking boots but had trouble finding them so I tried a pair of Lowas as a substitute. They felt a little small at first and wished I bought a 1/2 size bigger but over time discovered that the size was right. I wear these everyday/all day during the winter in Canada and love them. The only drawback was the price. Shipping them into Canada meant a lot of taxes, tariffs and shipping costs. i would recommend these and will by another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jack232

customer_reviews.title: Good Boot, but
customer_reviews.text: Fits as expected - was glad to read the other feedback out there regarding size issues - the Squeaking from the tongue is another matter - frigging aggravating, but the quality of the boot reminds me to ignore it - haven't tried the 'beeswax' fix that someone else posted - may go that route
customer_reviews.author: Edward Meade

customer_reviews.title: Boots are keepers!
customer_reviews.text: These Lowa boots are keepers! Fit is spot on. They got broken in in short order.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: OK but the design of the boot on the head ...
customer_reviews.text: OK but the design of the boot on the head is not rugged enough to sustain real "All terrain" so that I do not think I would walk with them long hours on the rugged mountain routes.
customer_reviews.author: S. K. Ming

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking boots under $200
customer_reviews.text: Extremely durable, great grip, very comfortable -- everything you want in a good boot.
customer_reviews.author: 9t2hoo

customer_reviews.title: Greatest footwear I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: They fit perfectly and are extremely comfy. I wore them for a 500 mile hike across Spain and they stayed in tact the whole time. I still wear them almost every day a year after I've returned. They are as comfy and in tact as ever! Awesome boots.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: These fit best at size 11
customer_reviews.text: A relatively lightweight hiking boot with Gore-tex waterproof lining. I've worn this same style and brand for more than six years. No complaints whatsoever. Just a note: I usually take a size 11. These fit best at size 11.5. I'm not sure if others feel they run small.
customer_reviews.author: Great Bear

customer_reviews.title: Not Western Washington waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. They were wet on the inside after 4 hours of hiking a drainage in Western Washington. I keep buying products that say waterproof then I get wet. Maybe we should have a separate designation for Western Washington waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Emuluk

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: these boots fit perfect right out of the box. Put 15 miles on these the day they arrived, and another 8 the next day. There doesn't seem to be a needed breakin period. very comfortable and have a very good grip on both wet and dry rocky terrian.
customer_reviews.author: james cridge

customer_reviews.title: Amazing boots!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the boots. Can't find them in the stores to find the perfect fit, so I purchased my typical size. The boots were tight around the toe box, even in the extra wide. Just returned them and ordered the next size up. Returning process was simple enough, and now I'm just waiting to receive the next size.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Great boots- great value from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Hiked up in the mountains over snow and ice for 4 hours in them after just wearing around in the house for a couple of days. No problems! Great boots!
customer_reviews.author: David Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best pair of hiking boots I've ever owned. Super comfortable and rugged construction. Great Great boots!!!
customer_reviews.author: Molon Labe

customer_reviews.title: No breaking in
customer_reviews.text: My husband loved these. He wears them everywhere. No braking in required and very warm. Will but Lowa every time!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: nice boots
customer_reviews.text: my feet were hurting before now I am walking pain free, they are what they claim they are, thanks (take care or your feet)
customer_reviews.author: Kent D. Lancaster

customer_reviews.title: A awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great boots really light weight very supportive well worth it husband loved them he didn't need any breaking in time
customer_reviews.author: sherry

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boot. I tried 8-10 different manufacturers, this was the best. It is expensive, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: LLVD

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boots!
customer_reviews.text: Best hiking boots I have ever owned! Very comfortable! Fit as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes. Love the leather lining. Very comfortable. Also very lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. Love the leather lining. Very comfortable. Also very lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Webster

customer_reviews.title: 7 miles later amazed at their "out of the box" condition
customer_reviews.text: Went down to the treadmill to do a quick break-in on these newbie... 7 miles later amazed at their "out of the box" condition. These babies are fantastic. Cant wait to get back out on the trail.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Rinker

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable from day one
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be well made time will tell. No break in period a plus.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS V. BASILE

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best boots ever. Well made, fits great and looks awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Jangjoon Cha

customer_reviews.title: Lowa Renegade LL Boots are well worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: Great price. 18% less than store retail. Ive worn Lowa Renegade LL Boots since 2013. A very strong, durable, light weight, well made boot. This is the best warm weather hiking boot i have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: its quality is good enough. but it's a little narrow
customer_reviews.text: its quality is good enough. but it's a little narrow , I think I can wear it in some cold days later.
customer_reviews.author: sean wang

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Bad stitching, poor fitting right shoe. Box torn. Looked like a returned item. Will return item.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto Villa

customer_reviews.title: right boot had a spot that rubbed the skin off ...
customer_reviews.text: right boot had a spot that rubbed the skin off the back of my heel. I put a bandaid on and now they are great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best boots ever for walking the sole pattern is on ...
customer_reviews.text: Best boots ever for walking the sole pattern is on track2nd pair cost was not a factor best walkin Boots ever just COOl!!!
customer_reviews.author: Barry T.

customer_reviews.title: Really comfy
customer_reviews.text: I sent these back due to the size. I ordered a full size larger than I wear and a wide fit version, but toes were still too close to tip with socks. Other than the short length, the boots were very... very comfortable. I was looking for a boot with more support than these and after trying on several pair, i went with a pair of Scarpa's. These would be great everyday walking boots, but lacking in support. If these would have fit, i probably would have kept them due to the great comfort. The internal leather liner is fantastic. They are very light as well.
customer_reviews.author: wesley reeve

customer_reviews.title: Great boot, but runs a little narrow
customer_reviews.text: As other reviews have noted, the sizing for this boot runs a little narrow. However, it is not necessarily narrow enough to go up a size.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Still warmer than expected
customer_reviews.text: These boot run t least a 1/2 size small. The fit is a little narrow in the foot but they tend to fit pretty good after a few long hikes. They are not as vented as they say and at 80 F they still were fairly warm, but not quite as warm as a GTX boot.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: I use a custom orthotic arch support. Have only ...
customer_reviews.text: I use a custom orthotic arch support. Have only worn on one hike. The heel on the previous pair started to delaminate after 3 hikes. Will judge after a few more hikes.
customer_reviews.author: jmw

customer_reviews.title: It is worm and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: It is really suitable for winder. It is worm and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: hi~

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: The boots are lined with a creamy soft leather. They seem similar to the high quality New Balance walking-hiking shoes I have had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: sastue

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable out of box pair of shoes I've ever owned. Great Quality!! i would highly recommend..
customer_reviews.author: William Levesque

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: GREAT BOOTS FIT IS PERFECT COMFORT OUT OF BOX IS AMAZING THANKS.
customer_reviews.author: James Bales

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear an 11D.. 90% of the shoes in my closet are this size. When I compared the insole of this boot to the insoles of my other 11D shoes, these were 1/8"-3/16" narrower. By the time I added liner and sock, they were obviously too narrow for me. I tried to exchange them for an "E" width but that was unavailable. Returning was painless So I never got to try them out in the field but they seem sturdy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H. Filippi

customer_reviews.title: Great  boots
customer_reviews.text: nice and comfortable ...recommend to buy .5 size larger to cater for thick socks
customer_reviews.author: Tay Gek Leng

customer_reviews.title: Almost
customer_reviews.text: Almost a great boot, but my feet are wide and the wide version of this boot is not. Runs narrow even in the wide. Of note, the fully leather lined is not. Leather lining ends at the ball of feet. Had to return them..
customer_reviews.author: ted kitchens

customer_reviews.title: Sized a bit large, but still LOVE them!
customer_reviews.text: I tried the shoe on at REI first and it was a perfect fit, so I was a bit surprised that it felt large. I've decided to do some different insoles to see if that helps, but even with the slightly large feel, I am loving them! I hope that the insole and a bit of a break-in will help them fit a bit better. They are close, just not "perfect".
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kenworthy

customer_reviews.title: These are light weight yet sturdy enough to provide good support
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a more substantial boot than my glorified tennis shoe Keens. These are light weight yet sturdy enough to provide good support. Even though my model is not waterproof, they have not let my feet get wet walking around in a foot of snow everyday for a week. The leather lining is very luxurious. They are not made in China, like most boots on the market today. So far, I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: andrea

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: As always with Lowa boots and shoes, they fit and feel broke in right out of the box... Another great boot....
customer_reviews.author: Charles S. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great boot, too large
customer_reviews.text: Wrong size (I wear an 11 and ordered an 11), still too big...I've tried them on locally and an 11 is just right, went ahead and bought local...
customer_reviews.author: kp

customer_reviews.title: still a comfortable boot.
customer_reviews.text: The only draw back is that the inside construction is different from what I already own.I wasn't aware there was a "foam" liner, I wanted a cloth liner on the inside, but never-the-less, still a comfortable boot.
customer_reviews.author: H S Woodward III DDS

customer_reviews.title: Too large in the heel box for my narrow heel.
customer_reviews.text: I have a narrow heel and it's been extremely difficult to find a boot that fits.When your heel slips,blisters are inevitable. I wish someone would bring back the Pivetta of the early 70s
customer_reviews.author: Bdog

customer_reviews.title: not gortex lined.
customer_reviews.text: boots are not gortex lined a deal breaker for me. Amazon ad said gortex , i should have checked lowa ad which is correctly listed.
customer_reviews.author: robert thompson

customer_reviews.title: high hopes dashed
customer_reviews.text: tried to emulate my joy of an older Bannf model boot-too loose and three days in the stitching that binds the leather lining to the gusset unraveled
customer_reviews.author: Bob Irwin

customer_reviews.title: Trouble was with my feet, maybe not the shoe
customer_reviews.text: I loved the shoe from the specs, but my feet did not like the shoe to wear. I went on two break in hikes with them, double socked and greased up, and still came back with horrible blisters on the back of my feet/lower Achilles area. I have low arches, but I'm not sure if that had any bearing. Shoes just weren't for me. Maybe go 1/2 size bigger and go with 2 socks for better comfort. Again, on paper, these are great boots.
customer_reviews.author: J. Busch

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever for 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: I initially had some concerns about shipping date on this product. Amazon came through and upgraded to one day shipping at no cost to me! The boots are the most comfortable I have ever worn. Also, the 2E boot size are wide and fit correctly from the go. Finally, a manufacturer that makes a quality product. EDIT! After wearing these boots for a hiking season the are falling apart. $200 for a hiking season is unacceptable even for the comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Pooch

customer_reviews.title: Insole
customer_reviews.text: Insole is not leather and makes my feet sweat that sucks. Unacceptable. The rest of the boot interior is leather and feels great. Unfortunate they ruined a good boot with a phony insole.
customer_reviews.author: James P.

product_meta.title: Lowa Men's Renegade II Leather-Lined Mid Hiking Boot
product_meta.description:
Ideal for day hikes and short-haul weekend pack trips, the LOWA Renegade GTX Hiking Boot combines versatility with comfort. Featuring a moisture-wicking footbed, full-length nylon shank, and shock-absorbent Vibram sole, these all-terrain hiking boots are designed to support lightweight packs up to 25 pounds.

MEN'S RENEGADE II LL
MID HIKING BOOT
AT A GLANCE:
 * All-terrain, glove leather-lined, hiking boots for day hikes and light backpacking
 * Climate-control footbed wicks away moisture for comfort
 * Durable Monowrap frame reduces boot weight
 * Full-length nylon shank for stability
 * Rugged Vibram outsole helps maintain grip

RENEGADE II LL Mid
This hiking boot features glove leather lining that molds to the contours of your feet for exceptional comfort. View larger.

 The Renegade's nubuck leather upper securely holds the foot in place, reducing strain on the toes during downhill sections. View larger. 

FEATURES LEATHER UPPER, LIGHTWEIGHT MIDSOLE, AND
VIBRAM OUTSOLE
The Renegade's nubuck leather upper securely holds the foot in place, reducing strain on the toes during downhill sections. Its Monowrap midsole technology reduces overall boot weight, while providing extra cushioning and lateral stability. A rugged Vibram outsole and thick, nonslip rubber lugs make these boots ideal for hiking, light backpacking, and other outdoor activities where you need traction and grip. This shoe is built on gender-specific, men's and women's lasts, for optimal fit and comfort. 

CLIMATE-CONTROL FOOTBED WICKS AWAY MOISTURE
 The Renegade boot features a climate-control footbed which keeps your feet cool, dry, and blister free. Perforations in the boot's lining allow air to circulate and wick moisture away from your foot, minimizing friction and fatigue. 

WATERPROOF GORE-TEX KEEPS FEET DRY
 Renegade boots with the GTX designation--including the Renegade II GTX LO and Renegade GTX Mid--feature breathable, waterproof GORE-TEX lining that reduces hot spots so your feet stay comfortable in warmer temperatures as well as cold, wet conditions. Renegade boots with the LL designation feature buttery-soft glove leather lining that molds to the contours of your feet for exceptional comfort. 

STABILIZING SHANKS AND DERBY-STYLE LACING
 These hiking boots feature a full-length nylon shank for extra stability on rugged terrain. Also, the derby-style lacing on the Renegade Mid boots ensures a customized fit for a wide variety of feet. 

ABOUT LOWA
 Handcrafted in Europe for close to 90 years, LOWA boots have been acclaimed by climbers, mountaineers, and hikers as the finest outdoor boots in the world. LOWA incorporates thoughtful design and superb materials with clean, environmental manufacturing processes and fair labor standards. When you own a pair of LOWAs, you can be confident you're wearing authentic outdoor footwear that "walks the talk" when it comes to quality, performance, and sustainability. 

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
LOWA Men's Renegade II LL Mid Hiking Boot.

RENEGADE COLLECTION
Men's Renegade GTX Mid Hiking Boot

Women's Renegade GTX Mid Hiking Boot

Men's Renegade II GTX LO Hiking Shoe

Women's Renegade II GTX LO Hiking Shoe

Men's Renegade II Leather-Lined Mid Hiking Boot

Women's Renegade II Leather-Lined Mid Hiking Boot

Men's Renegade II LL Low Hiking Boot

Women's Renegade II LL Low Hiking Boot

TRADEMARK INFORMATION:
PU Monowrap® Frame

GORE-TEX®

Vibram® Evo



For close to 90 years, LOWA boots have been acclaimed by climbers, mountaineers and hikers as the finest outdoor boots in the world. Every LOWA boot is handcrafted in Europe, where they incorporate the elements of thoughtful design, superb materials, clean manufacturing processes and fair labor standards. When you own a pair of LOWAs, you can be confident that you're wearing authentic outdoor footwear that "walks the talk" when it comes to quality, performance and sustainability.
feature_bullets: Lace-up nubuck hiking boot with embroidered logo at side and padded tonge and collar
